intro: Jacquemontia bahiensis, commonly known as the Bahia jacquemontia, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces violet to purple blooms that typically appear in the summer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological and horticultural studies.
